item.title: A decade in, bootstrapped Thinkst Canary reaches $20M in ARR without VC funding
item.dc:creator: Zack Whittaker
item.description: Reflecting on 10 years since its launch, the honeypot maker explains why the company did not take on any VC funding.

item.title: Meta AI now has 1B monthly active users
item.dc:creator: Aisha Malik
item.description: Meta AI now has one billion monthly active users across its apps, CEO Mark Zuckerberg said at the company’s annual shareholder meeting on Wednesday, as first reported by CNBC. The new milestone doubles the 500 million monthly active users Meta AI had back in September 2024. The “focus for this year is deepening the experience […]

item.title: 7 days until doors open at TechCrunch Sessions: AI
item.dc:creator: TechCrunch Events
item.description: We’re on the final stretch! TechCrunch Sessions: AI kicks off in just 7 days. Main stage and breakout sessions feature AI leaders from Google Cloud, Anthropic, OpenAI, Twelve Labs, and more. It’s your moment to connect, learn, and network at high velocity. Now’s the time to move—lock in your ticket and save $300, plus score […]

item.title: Apple to change the way it names operating systems, report says
item.dc:creator: Dominic-Madori Davis
item.description: Apple will reportedly change the way it names its operating systems, per a Bloomberg report.  Operating systems will now be named by year, meaning the update after the current iOS 18 will be iOS 26 rather than, say, iOS 19. The change paves the way for a less confusing, more consistent branding among Apple products. […]

item.title: Volteras wants to connect to more EVs than anyone else
item.dc:creator: Tim De Chant
item.description: Volteras has raised $11.1 million to expand its connected car offerings to automakers and companies that want to interact with EVs.

item.title: The New York Times and Amazon ink AI licensing deal
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Bellan
item.description: Nearly two years after suing OpenAI and Microsoft for copyright infringement, The New York Times has agreed to license its editorial content to Amazon to train the tech giant’s AI platforms.

item.title: Zeal Capital Partners announces close of $82M Fund II
item.dc:creator: Dominic-Madori Davis
item.description: Zeal Capital Partners announced on Wednesday the close of its second fund, raising $82 million. Limited partners in the fund include Citi Impact Fund, M&T Bank, Wells Fargo, and Spelman College. It hopes to invest in at least 25 early-stage companies, writing check sizes between $1 million and $2.3 million, with 50% of the fund […]

item.title: Buildots raises $45M to help companies track construction progress
item.dc:creator: Kyle Wiggers
item.description: In the construction industry, managers can easily become disconnected from what’s happening on-site. Among the many tasks to juggle are staying apprised of costs, communicating with all stakeholders, and assessing risk related to aspects like contractor billing and performance. Buildots wants to change all of that through AI and computer vision. Founded in 2018 by […]

item.title: Meet LoveJack, the dating app designed for users to find love using just five words
item.dc:creator: Lauren Forristal
item.description: As Kevin Malone from “The Office” once said, “Why waste time say lot word when few word do trick?”  For Julia LeStage and Lisa Le, the creators of a new dating app called LoveJack, finding love online doesn’t have to feel like filling out a mountain of paperwork. Sometimes, all you need are a few […]

item.title: X hits pause on its encrypted DMs feature
item.dc:creator: Ivan Mehta
item.description: X said it will work on "making some improvements" to the encrypted DMs feature. It didn't mention when the feature might be available again.

item.title: Elon Musk’s stint in the US government is coming to an end
item.dc:creator: Ram Iyer, Ivan Mehta
item.description: Elon Musk confirmed on Wednesday that he's ending his stint as a U.S. special government employee and as the de-facto head of DOGE.

item.title: NVIDIA, AMD may soon start selling new AI chips in China to comply with US restrictions
item.dc:creator: Ivan Mehta
item.description: NVIDIA and AMD will soon begin selling new GPUs made for AI workloads in China to comply with US chip export restrictions.

item.title: Lightspeed backs Indian home services startup Snabbit as the next big consumer trend
item.dc:creator: Jagmeet Singh
item.description: Home services in India — whether it is cleaning, dishwashing, or laundry — have traditionally been offline and informally run. This has often resulted in delays and uncertainties for consumers, as well as inconsistent pay and job insecurity for workers. Recently, however, startups have begun viewing this area as ripe for transformation, leveraging technology to […]

item.title: Founder Sahil Lavingia says he was booted from DOGE after just 55 days
item.dc:creator: Julie Bort
item.description: Sahil Lavingia has published a diary recounting his time as a member of Elon Musk’s DOGE workforce. It’s a short read — Lavingia’s DOGE stint lasted just 55 days — but it does provide new details on the temporary government organization formed by President Trump’s executive order. Lavingia is a well-known name in Silicon Valley, […]

item.title: Security startup Horizon3.ai is raising $100M in new round
item.dc:creator: Jagmeet Singh, Marina Temkin
item.description: Horizon3.ai, a cybersecurity startup that provides tools like autonomous penetration testing, is seeking to raise $100 million in a new funding round and has locked down at least $73 million, the company revealed in an SEC filing this week. NEA led the round, according to two people familiar with the deal. One person said that […]

item.title: Nvidia expects to lose billions in revenue due to H20 chip licensing requirements
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Szkutak
item.description: Nvidia incurred a $4.5 billion charge in Q1 due to licensing requirements impacting its ability to sell its H20 AI chip to companies in China.

item.title: Victoria’s Secret hit by outages as it battles security incident
item.dc:creator: Zack Whittaker, Lorenzo Franceschi-Bicchierai
item.description: The fashion retailer's outages began Monday.

item.title: GameStop bought $500 million of bitcoin
item.dc:creator: Amanda Silberling
item.description: GameStop's recent interest in bitcoin isn't as random as it may seem.

item.title: Stellantis pivots to Google’s Android as in-car partnership with Amazon ends
item.dc:creator: Kirsten Korosec
item.description: Stellantis told TechCrunch it would be pivoting to an Android-based system.

item.title: DeepSeek: Everything you need to know about the AI chatbot app
item.dc:creator: Kyle Wiggers
item.description: DeepSeek has gone viral. Chinese AI lab DeepSeek broke into the mainstream consciousness this week after its chatbot app rose to the top of the Apple App Store charts (and Google Play, as well). DeepSeek’s AI models, which were trained using compute-efficient techniques, have led Wall Street analysts — and technologists — to question whether the U.S. can maintain its […]
